gettysburg.common

Interface TestGbgGame

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GbgGame

    public interface TestGbgGame
extends GbgGame

    TestGbgGame is an interface that is used for testing purposes. It adds well-defined methods to the GbgGame interface so that a game state can be altered in order to run unit tests easily.

    There is non-determinancy in the game so running a script of a series of moves does not guarantee deterministic results necessary for testing. This interface allows the tester to inject a starting state and script battle results in order to have deterministic outcomes for battles.

    The game engine implementers need to provide a single TestGbgGameImpl class that implements this interface. This class will be in a test source folder, not the src source folder.

    This class does not have to do any consistency checking for the methods defined. We assume that the test knows how to properly set up the game.

    In order to implement the test game implementation, several of the internal variables in the game implementation class will most likely need to have their scope changed from public to protected.

    When a test game instance is created, the game will be at the start, just like the GbgGame instance.
    Version:
    Jul 27, 2017

      • Methods inherited from interface gettysburg.common.GbgGame

        endBattleStep, endMoveStep, endStep, getBattlesToResolve, getCurrentStep, getGameDate, getPossibleMoves, getSquareDescriptor, getTurnNumber, getUnitFacing, getUnitsAt, load, moveUnit, resolveBattle, setUnitFacing, store, whereIsUnit, whereIsUnit

    • Method Detail

      • clearBoard

        default void clearBoard()
        Clears the board of all units, including those at the start of the game. Sets the turn counter to the beginning of the game, turn 0.

      • putUnitAt

        default void putUnitAt(GbgUnit unit,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       Direction facing)
        Places the specified unit at the location, facing in the direction specified. If there is a unit already on the space, then the units will be stacked.
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit to place
        x - the x-cell of where to place the unit
        y - the y-cell of where to place the unit
        facing - the direction the unit is facing

      • setGameTurn

        default void setGameTurn(int turn)
        Set the internal game turn. Turn 0 is the start of the game, and it increases by 1 for each complete game turn.
        Parameters:
        turn - the turn number to set the game to.

      • setGameStep

        default void setGameStep(GbgGameStep step)
        Set the step of the game turn to the specified step.
        Parameters:
        step - the step that the game is in for the current turn

      • setBattleResult

        default void setBattleResult(BattleDescriptor battle,
                             BattleResult result)
        Set the battle result for the specified battle.
        Parameters:
        battle - the battle to be fought
        result - the result to return

      • setBattleResults

        default void setBattleResults(java.util.List<BattleResult> results)

        Provide a list of battle results that the test game will use when asked to resolve a battle. It sequentially goes through the list until the list is empty, at which time, it will revert to normal battle resolution.

        If this method is called and there is a previous list that has not been completely used, this list replaces the old list.

        Parameters:
        results -
